history.content: There have been accomodations to make the remote labs more manageable, as they were taking a lot longer than traditional.

children.subject: Pace of the main portion of the class is the same as far as I can tell, some content has been removed from labs so that people have more time to work on them. However if possible I'd recommend waiting to take 16B until in-person classes resume, since the lab experience (especially getting instructor help) is a lot better in person.

If you are a first year, waiting a semester until taking 16B may be possible. But keep in mind, it's getting harder and harder for juniors and seniors to get into 16B and this can cause anxiety later on--don't wait too long to take it! If you are a second year I would take it anyway esp. if you are going the EE or ML route.
In what ways have those accommodations been made?

I took EECS 16B this summer. First, I want to acknowledge that I'm not playing dramatic or pretentious here. Before I took 16B, I heard very bad comments on the course like many of you did. But while I was taking it, I have to say that it's a legit introductory EE course that has enlightening aspects. Even the labs were indeed notoriously tedious when something didn't work and I had to debug and rewired or ran after my little deviating car around my house seemingly that I was taking PE rather than EE course. But the remote labs were still managed very well and accessible. The staff paid a lot of attention to us and tried their best to accommodate our needs. To many students that 16B may be a class with very boring and basic materials, but to me who had no prior experience on EE and signals, forgot most Physics stuff and just focused on CS sides and originally took the class only to fulfill the requirement, 16B really led me to a new understanding of the world of EE (but I still decide to focus on CS since EE is still too hard for me). Most importantly, after spending too much time on the Digital side with 0s and 1s, 16B reminds me of the beauty of the Analog. Maybe I didn't answer your questions well but I still recommend you taking it sooner than later even under the remote setting.

history.content:
Hello!

I hope you are all hanging in there. 

Can current 16B students please tell me what the atmosphere looks like in 16B? What changes have been made to accommodate the fact that we are in a remote setting? Has content been removed from the class? Is the pace of the class slower? 

I remember struggling a lot for 16A so I am quite concerned how next semester would look like for me. 

Thank you and good luck to you all this semester!
history.subject: Current EECS 16B Students
